documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Protocol Amendment Summary to Section 8, which details procedures specific to screening sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to the COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference in Risk Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation as a mitigation strategy for various potential risks.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for data on ALXN1840 and ammonium tetrathiomolybdate studies.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Features Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 4 for a description of adaptive protocol features and their limits.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 7 for criteria on when a dose should be decreased or interrupted.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference for Rationale
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the current Investigator's Brochure (IB) regarding nonclinical data on copper elimination.

documentContentReferences.name: Blood Donation Restriction Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 5.2 from Table 5 regarding restrictions on blood donation prior to screening.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraception Methods Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.4 for a description of appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraception Start Time Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 5.1 (inclusion criteria) for start times for contraceptive use.

documentContentReferences.name: Intervention Discontinuation Procedures
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the Schedule of Activities (SoA, Section 1.3) for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.2.6 regarding discontinuation from study intervention due to pregnancy.

documentContentReferences.name: Participant Withdrawal Procedures
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the Schedule of Activities (SoA, Section 1.3) for data to be collected at the time of study discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: ECG Withdrawal Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, follow-up, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 7.3 for the definition of 'lost to follow-up'.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Non-use Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.7 clarifying that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Pharmacokinetics Sample Collection Schedule
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of whole blood sample collection for PK measurements.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.1.1 for details of molybdenum measured in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Pharmacodynamics Sample Collection Schedule
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of blood sample collection for PD assessments.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Details Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.6 and Section 8.1.1 for details of copper and other biomarker measurements.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 8 for the definitions of the population sets used for analyses.

documentContentReferences.name: ECG Analysis Time Points
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the SoA (Table 1) for specified time points for ECG parameter measurements.

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigatorâ€™s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Current protocol version. Clarifies study procedures in the US to facilitate participant recruitment.
